examples.text: There are very few vacant properties available in the area.
The seat next to him was vacant.
a **vacant lot** *(= a piece of land in a city that is not being used)*
There is a room vacant, as it happens.
A seat became vacant and he sat down in it.

definitions.definition: if a job in a company is vacant, nobody is doing it and it is available for somebody to take

examples.text: When the post finally fell *(= became)* vacant, they offered it to Fiona.
**Situations Vacant** (= a section in a newspaper or on a website where jobs are advertised)
The position left vacant in July has not yet been filled.
The job will be kept vacant for a few more weeks.
The office of president had been left vacant since her retirement.

definitions.definition: showing no sign that the person is thinking of anything

examples.text: She had large vacant brown eyes.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin vacant- ‘remaining empty’, from the verb vacare.
